segment.source: Update a KMDF device driver
segment.target: Update a KMDF device driver

segment.source: Update a KMDF device driver
segment.target: Update a KMDF device driver

segment.source: Update a KMDF device driver
segment.target: Update a KMDF device driver

segment.source: Like all other components that are added to the OS, KMDF (Kernel-Mode Driver Framework) drivers are included in the OS image by using .spkg package files that are referenced by an OEMInput.xml file when OEMs builds the image.
segment.target: Like all other components that are added to the OS, KMDF (Kernel-Mode Driver Framework) drivers are included in the OS image by using .spkg package files that are referenced by an OEMInput.xml file when OEMs builds the image.

segment.source: Similarly, driver updates are published by using .spkg package files.
segment.target: Similarly, driver updates are published by using .spkg package files.

segment.source: Like all package updates, the package version must be incremented for each update; for more information, see Update requirements.
segment.target: Like all package updates, the package version must be incremented for each update; for more information, see Update requirements.

segment.source: When driver updates are prepared, the value of the DriverVer directive in the driver INF file must also be incremented.
segment.target: When driver updates are prepared, the value of the DriverVer directive in the driver INF file must also be incremented.

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how to prepare a KMDF device driver update and confirm that the updated driver is loaded by the OS.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how to prepare a KMDF device driver update and confirm that the updated driver is loaded by the OS.

segment.source: This topic assumes that you are familiar with the general concepts associated with Windows device driver installation and the use of the INF file.
segment.target: This topic assumes that you are familiar with the general concepts associated with Windows device driver installation and the use of the INF file.

segment.source: For more information, see Device and driver installation.
segment.target: For more information, see Device and driver installation.

segment.source: Driver INF files and updates
segment.target: Driver INF files and updates

segment.source: Visual Studio automatically generates an INF file when building a Windows 10 Mobile KMDF driver project.
segment.target: Visual Studio automatically generates an INF file when building a Windows 10 Mobile KMDF driver project.

segment.source: In Windows, driver installation uses the INF file directly.
segment.target: In Windows, driver installation uses the INF file directly.

segment.source: However, in Windows 10 Mobile, the INF file is converted to a registry entries (.reg) file.
segment.target: However, in Windows 10 Mobile, the INF file is converted to a registry entries (.reg) file.

segment.source: The .reg file is included in the .spkg file when the driver is packaged.
segment.target: The .reg file is included in the .spkg file when the driver is packaged.

segment.source: When creating a KMDF driver update, two version numbers must be incremented: the version number of the .spkg package file and the DriverVer value in the INF file.
segment.target: When creating a KMDF driver update, two version numbers must be incremented: the version number of the .spkg package file and the DriverVer value in the INF file.

segment.source: Package version
segment.target: Package version

segment.source: The package version number must be incremented to cause the update to be applied to the OS.
segment.target: The package version number must be incremented to cause the update to be applied to the OS.

segment.source: If the update package version is not greater than the existing version, the update will not be applied.
segment.target: If the update package version is not greater than the existing version, the update will not be applied.

segment.source: INF driver version
segment.target: INF driver version

segment.source: The INF driver version number must be incremented to cause the updated driver data to be applied to the active driver registry key in the System hive.
segment.target: The INF driver version number must be incremented to cause the updated driver data to be applied to the active driver registry key in the System hive.

segment.source: The driver version is specified in the following format:
segment.target: The driver version is specified in the following format:

segment.source:
MM
DD
YYYY, n.
segment.target:
MM
DD
YYYY, n.

segment.source: n.
segment.target: n.

segment.source: n.
segment.target: n.

segment.source: n
segment.target: n

segment.source: MM is month, DD is day, and YYYY is year, followed by the version number.
segment.target: MM is month, DD is day, and YYYY is year, followed by the version number.

segment.source: The first digit of the version number is the major version, followed by the minor versions.
segment.target: The first digit of the version number is the major version, followed by the minor versions.

segment.source: For driver updates, the entire string is evaluated as the version number.
segment.target: For driver updates, the entire string is evaluated as the version number.

segment.source: If just the date (MMDDYYYY) is incremented, it is considered to be a newer version of the driver.
segment.target: If just the date (MMDDYYYY) is incremented, it is considered to be a newer version of the driver.

segment.source: Driver walkthrough introduction
segment.target: Driver walkthrough introduction

segment.source: The driver update walkthrough covers the following tasks:
segment.target: The driver update walkthrough covers the following tasks:

segment.target: Build the version 1 driver package

segment.target: Examine the registry keys to confirm that the driver is active

segment.target: Build the version 2 driver package

segment.target: Add the version 2 driver to the OS

segment.target: Confirm that the updated driver is active

segment.source: In this example, the following version numbers are used:
segment.target: In this example, the following version numbers are used:

segment.source: Driver version in INF file
segment.target: Driver version in INF file

segment.source: Package version
segment.target: Package version

segment.source: The driver file is named XKmdfDriver.sys, and the INF file is XKmdfDriver.inf.
segment.target: The driver file is named XKmdfDriver.sys, and the INF file is XKmdfDriver.inf.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace these file names with the name of the driver that you want to use in this walkthrough.
segment.target: Replace these file names with the name of the driver that you want to use in this walkthrough.

segment.source: The original driver will be located in the Version1 folder, and the updated version will be located in Version2.
segment.target: The original driver will be located in the Version1 folder, and the updated version will be located in Version2.

segment.source: The walkthrough assumes that the following environmental variables are similar to what is shown here:
segment.target: The walkthrough assumes that the following environmental variables are similar to what is shown here:

segment.source: Build the version 1 driver package
segment.target: Build the version 1 driver package

segment.source: Use the following steps to include the version 1 driver in the OS.
segment.target: Use the following steps to include the version 1 driver in the OS.

segment.source: Copy the driver files to the Version1 directory:
segment.target: Copy the driver files to the Version1 directory:

segment.source: XKmdfDriver.inf
segment.target: XKmdfDriver.inf

segment.source: XKmdfdriver.pkg.xml
segment.target: XKmdfdriver.pkg.xml

segment.source: XKmdfDriver.sys
segment.target: XKmdfDriver.sys

segment.source: In the XKmdfDriver.inf file, set the directive in the section as shown here.
segment.target: In the XKmdfDriver.inf file, set the directive in the section as shown here.

segment.source: The highlighted string "11/01/2012,1.00.00.00" is the version number of the driver.
segment.target: The highlighted string "11/01/2012,1.00.00.00" is the version number of the driver.

segment.source: The package XML (XKmdfdriver.pkg.xml) for the version 1 driver, is shown below.
segment.target: The package XML (XKmdfdriver.pkg.xml) for the version 1 driver, is shown below.

segment.source: Specify an OEM name.
segment.target: Specify an OEM name.

segment.source: Move to the Version1 directory, set the package version as shown, and build the driver package.
segment.target: Move to the Version1 directory, set the package version as shown, and build the driver package.

segment.source: Confirm that the OEMName.Phone.Test.BaseOS.XKmdfDriver.spkg package was built.
segment.target: Confirm that the OEMName.Phone.Test.BaseOS.XKmdfDriver.spkg package was built.

segment.source: Add the version 1 driver to the OS
segment.target: Add the version 1 driver to the OS

segment.source: Use the following steps to include the version 1 driver in the OS by using IUTool and a production or test build.
segment.target: Use the following steps to include the version 1 driver in the OS by using IUTool and a production or test build.

segment.source: Alternatively, include the package in an image and then flash that image to the phone.
segment.target: Alternatively, include the package in an image and then flash that image to the phone.

segment.source: Connect the device to the PC by using a USB cable.
segment.target: Connect the device to the PC by using a USB cable.

segment.source: Use IuTool to add the version 1 driver package to an existing image.
segment.target: Use IuTool to add the version 1 driver package to an existing image.

segment.source: Confirm that the IuTool was able to deploy the package to the device
segment.target: Confirm that the IuTool was able to deploy the package to the device

segment.source: View the driver registry settings
segment.target: View the driver registry settings

segment.source: Use the following process to mount the device in mass storage mode and view the registry.
segment.target: Use the following process to mount the device in mass storage mode and view the registry.

segment.source: Reboot the device to USB mass storage mode.
segment.target: Reboot the device to USB mass storage mode.

segment.source: This is done by using a specific key sequence on the phone—for example, holding the camera button down when powering up.
segment.target: This is done by using a specific key sequence on the phone—for example, holding the camera button down when powering up.

segment.source: Connect the device to the PC with a USB cable.
segment.target: Connect the device to the PC with a USB cable.

segment.source: When the device is connected to the PC in USB mass storage mode, it will appear as a logical drive on the PC.
segment.target: When the device is connected to the PC in USB mass storage mode, it will appear as a logical drive on the PC.

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window as an administrator.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window as an administrator.

segment.source: Locate the registry SYSTEM hive under the folder WINDOWSSYSTEM32CONFIG.
segment.target: Locate the registry SYSTEM hive under the folder WINDOWSSYSTEM32CONFIG.

segment.source: Start the Registry Editor (Regedit.exe) on the PC.
segment.target: Start the Registry Editor (Regedit.exe) on the PC.

segment.source: In the Registry Editor, click FileLoad Hive and load the SYSTEM hive.
segment.target: In the Registry Editor, click FileLoad Hive and load the SYSTEM hive.

segment.source: Provide a name for the imported hive—for this example, DRIVERVERSION1
segment.target: Provide a name for the imported hive—for this example, DRIVERVERSION1

segment.source: Proceed to the next section to examine the contents of the imported registry hive.
segment.target: Proceed to the next section to examine the contents of the imported registry hive.

segment.source: Examine the registry keys to confirm that the driver is active
segment.target: Examine the registry keys to confirm that the driver is active

segment.source: When Windows 10 Mobile installs the driver, the following registry keys appear in the SYSTEM hive:
segment.target: When Windows 10 Mobile installs the driver, the following registry keys appear in the SYSTEM hive:

segment.source: A driver-specific registry key is created under .
segment.target: A driver-specific registry key is created under .

segment.source: An active driver subkey is created under .
segment.target: An active driver subkey is created under .

segment.source: Each of these two areas is discussed in the following sections.
segment.target: Each of these two areas is discussed in the following sections.

segment.source: Use this information in the registry to determine if the driver is ready to be installed and if the OS has recognized the hardware and installed the proper version of the driver.
segment.target: Use this information in the registry to determine if the driver is ready to be installed and if the OS has recognized the hardware and installed the proper version of the driver.

segment.source: Driver database
segment.target: Driver database

segment.source: Driver settings are staged for later installation in .
segment.target: Driver settings are staged for later installation in .

segment.source: The OS uses this subkey to install drivers when the new hardware is identified.
segment.target: The OS uses this subkey to install drivers when the new hardware is identified.

segment.source: It contains:
segment.target: It contains:

segment.source: Information about the XKmdfDriver.inf
segment.target: Information about the XKmdfDriver.inf

segment.source: A specific GUID that identifies the XKmdfDriver as a SYSTEM class driver, not a driver that uses a dynamically enumerable bus (such as ACPI or USB).
segment.target: A specific GUID that identifies the XKmdfDriver as a SYSTEM class driver, not a driver that uses a dynamically enumerable bus (such as ACPI or USB).

segment.source: This example uses a system class driver to simplify the walkthrough, but the concepts illustrated are similar with other types of drivers.
segment.target: This example uses a system class driver to simplify the walkthrough, but the concepts illustrated are similar with other types of drivers.

segment.source: When the package is installed, the XKmkdfDriver.inf is added to , where is the system driver GUID.
segment.target: When the package is installed, the XKmkdfDriver.inf is added to , where is the system driver GUID.

segment.source: The following shows the system driver GUID in the registry subkey.
segment.target: The following shows the system driver GUID in the registry subkey.

segment.source: Under the subkey, the active INF file is specified with the entry .
segment.target: Under the subkey, the active INF file is specified with the entry .

segment.source: The entry is pointing to the active driver INF.
segment.target: The entry is pointing to the active driver INF.

segment.source: When the driver package is updated, there are multiple INF settings, and points to the latest one.
segment.target: When the driver package is updated, there are multiple INF settings, and points to the latest one.

segment.source: The subkey contains a replication of the XKmdfDriver.inf contents.
segment.target: The subkey contains a replication of the XKmdfDriver.inf contents.

segment.source: This subkey references the service associated with the system driver:
segment.target: This subkey references the service associated with the system driver:

segment.source: This subkey sets the driver description strings:
segment.target: This subkey sets the driver description strings:

segment.source: This subkey sets the value of the driver description string:
segment.target: This subkey sets the value of the driver description string:

segment.source: Control set enumeration
segment.target: Control set enumeration

segment.source: is created when the OS successfully installs the matching device driver with the INF file.
segment.target: is created when the OS successfully installs the matching device driver with the INF file.

segment.source: For more information, see HKLMSYSTEMCurrentControlSetEnum Registry Tree on MSDN.
segment.target: For more information, see HKLMSYSTEMCurrentControlSetEnum Registry Tree on MSDN.

segment.source: The subkey contains information for controlling system startup and some aspects of device.
segment.target: The subkey contains information for controlling system startup and some aspects of device.

segment.source: For more information, see HKLMSYSTEMCurrentControlSetControl Registry Tree on MSDN.
segment.target: For more information, see HKLMSYSTEMCurrentControlSetControl Registry Tree on MSDN.

segment.source: indicates that the driver has the 120th rank among SYSTEM class drivers.
segment.target: indicates that the driver has the 120th rank among SYSTEM class drivers.

segment.source: This subkey includes the driver date and version as shown here:
segment.target: This subkey includes the driver date and version as shown here:

segment.source: The DeviceClasses subkey includes the device instance ID:
segment.target: The DeviceClasses subkey includes the device instance ID:

segment.source: This next subkey associates the XKmdfDriver with the system containerId 00000000-0000-0000-ffff-ffffffffffff:
segment.target: This next subkey associates the XKmdfDriver with the system containerId 00000000-0000-0000-ffff-ffffffffffff:

segment.source: contains information about the installed driver.
segment.target: contains information about the installed driver.

segment.source: It has one instance, :
segment.target: It has one instance, :

segment.source: contains the driver file "ImagePath" value; it is ASCII characters encoded in hexadecimal binary format.
segment.target: contains the driver file "ImagePath" value; it is ASCII characters encoded in hexadecimal binary format.

segment.source: The actual value is "ImagePath" = REGEXPANDSZ: "SystemRootSystem32driversXKmdfDriver.sys".
segment.target: The actual value is "ImagePath" = REGEXPANDSZ: "SystemRootSystem32driversXKmdfDriver.sys".

segment.target: For more information, see Registry Value Types on MSDN.

segment.source: contains the WDF version number:
segment.target: contains the WDF version number:

segment.source: Close the tools and eject the device
segment.target: Close the tools and eject the device

segment.source: In the Registry Editor, click FileUnload Hive to unload the hive, so that the PC registry is restored to its previous state.
segment.target: In the Registry Editor, click FileUnload Hive to unload the hive, so that the PC registry is restored to its previous state.

segment.source: Close the Registry Editor.
segment.target: Close the Registry Editor.

segment.source: Close the Command Prompt window and any open instances of Windows Explorer that were used to view the temp folder.
segment.target: Close the Command Prompt window and any open instances of Windows Explorer that were used to view the temp folder.

segment.source: Eject the phone (use Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media in the notification area or the Windows Explorer Eject command), and then disconnect the device from the PC.
segment.target: Eject the phone (use Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media in the notification area or the Windows Explorer Eject command), and then disconnect the device from the PC.

segment.source: Build the version 2 driver package
segment.target: Build the version 2 driver package

segment.source: As described earlier, the new driver version will be 2/19/2013,1.32.00.00, which will be contained in a new package version, 8.00.10211.25.
segment.target: As described earlier, the new driver version will be 2/19/2013,1.32.00.00, which will be contained in a new package version, 8.00.10211.25.

segment.source: Create a second copy of the driver files in the Version2 directory.
segment.target: Create a second copy of the driver files in the Version2 directory.

segment.source: Edit the XKmdfDriver.inf file and change to 02/19/2013,1.32.00.00.
segment.target: Edit the XKmdfDriver.inf file and change to 02/19/2013,1.32.00.00.

segment.source: Add a new registry value named "DW123", of type DWORD.
segment.target: Add a new registry value named "DW123", of type DWORD.

segment.source: The presence of this key is used as an additional indication that the version 2 driver is active.
segment.target: The presence of this key is used as an additional indication that the version 2 driver is active.

segment.source: Move to the Version2 directory, set the package version, and build the package.
segment.target: Move to the Version2 directory, set the package version, and build the package.

segment.source: Add the version 2 driver to the OS
segment.target: Add the version 2 driver to the OS

segment.source: Use the following steps to include the version 2 driver in the OS using IUTool and a production or test build:
segment.target: Use the following steps to include the version 2 driver in the OS using IUTool and a production or test build:

segment.source: Connect the device to the PC by using a USB cable.
segment.target: Connect the device to the PC by using a USB cable.

segment.source: Use IuTool to add the version 2 driver package to an existing image.
segment.target: Use IuTool to add the version 2 driver package to an existing image.

segment.source: Confirm that the IUTool was able to deploy the package to the device
segment.target: Confirm that the IUTool was able to deploy the package to the device

segment.source: Confirm that the updated driver is active
segment.target: Confirm that the updated driver is active

segment.source: Use the following process to confirm that the updated driver is active.
segment.target: Use the following process to confirm that the updated driver is active.

segment.source: Use the process described previously in View the driver registry settings to load and view the system registry hive.
segment.target: Use the process described previously in View the driver registry settings to load and view the system registry hive.

segment.source: DriverPackages should have two INF registry key sets: one for the previously installed driver and the one for the updated driver.
segment.target: DriverPackages should have two INF registry key sets: one for the previously installed driver and the one for the updated driver.

segment.source: in XKmdfDriver.inf should point to the newer INF key:
segment.target: in XKmdfDriver.inf should point to the newer INF key:

segment.source: The driver still has the 120th rank under SYSTEM Class driver, but the date and version should be updated.
segment.target: The driver still has the 120th rank under SYSTEM Class driver, but the date and version should be updated.

segment.source: "DriverDate"="2-19-2013"
segment.target: "DriverDate"="2-19-2013"

segment.source: "DriverVersion"="1.32.0.0"
segment.target: "DriverVersion"="1.32.0.0"

segment.source: The newly added DWORD registry value DW123 should appear under the subkey.
segment.target: The newly added DWORD registry value DW123 should appear under the subkey.

segment.source: Use the process described earlier in Close the tools and eject the phone to safely disconnect the device
segment.target: Use the process described earlier in Close the tools and eject the phone to safely disconnect the device
